source_sentence: 佛說救面然餓鬼陀羅尼神呪經
translation: Dhāraṇī Sutra for Saving the Burning-Mouth Hungry Ghost

source_sentence: 一卷
translation: one scroll

source_sentence: 唐于闐三藏實叉難陀譯
translation: Translated by the Tang Yutan Tripiṭaka Śikṣānanda

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊在迦毘羅城尼俱律那僧伽藍所，與諸比丘，并諸菩薩、無數眾生周匝圍繞，而為說法。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was in the monastery of the Nirgrantha community in Kapilavastu, surrounded by monks, bodhisattvas, and countless other sentient beings, and he was teaching.

source_sentence: 爾時，阿難獨居淨處，一心計念。
translation: At the time, Ānanda was staying alone in a pure place, concentrating his thoughts.

source_sentence: 即於其夜三更之後，見一餓鬼，名曰「面然」，住阿難前，白阿難言：「却後三日，汝命將盡，即便生此餓鬼之中。」
translation: Just after the third watch of the night, he saw a hungry ghost named "Miliṇḍa" standing in front of Ānanda and saying to him, "In the next three days, your life will end, and you'll be born among these hungry ghosts."

source_sentence: 是時，阿難聞此語已，心生惶怖，問餓鬼言：「我此災禍，作何方計，得免斯苦？」
translation: After hearing this, Ānanda became frightened and asked the hungry ghost, "What can I do to avoid this misfortune for myself?"

source_sentence: 爾時，餓鬼報阿難言：「汝於晨朝，若能布施百千那由他恒河沙數餓鬼，并百千婆羅門及仙人等，以摩伽陀國斗，各施一斗飲食，并及為我供養三寶，汝得增壽，令我離於餓鬼之苦、得生天上。」
translation: The hungry ghost then reported to Ānanda, "In the morning, if you could give a hundred thousand hungry ghosts, one hundred thousand Brahmans, sages, and so forth, one bucket of food and drink each from the land of Magadha, and make offerings to the Three Treasures for me, you'd have an increased life span, which would free me from the suffering of hungry ghosts and allow me to be born up in heaven."

source_sentence: 阿難見此面然餓鬼，身形羸瘦、枯燋極醜、面上火然、其咽如針、頭髮蓬亂、毛爪長利，身如負重，又聞如是不順之語，甚大驚怖，身毛皆竪。
translation: When Ānanda saw this bespectacled hungry ghost with a thin, withered, extremely ugly body, a face like a fire, a throat like a needle, unruly hair, long, sharp nails, and a body like a heavy load, and heard such disagreeable words, he was terrified and his hair stood on end.

source_sentence: 即從座起，疾至佛所，五體投地，頂禮佛足，身心戰慄，而白佛言：「救我！
translation: He got up from his seat, rushed to the Buddha, threw his five bodies to the ground, bowed his head at his feet, and trembled in body and spirit as he said to the Buddha, "Help me!

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 救我！
translation: Help me!

source_sentence: 善逝！
translation: Well gone!

source_sentence: 過此三日，命將終盡。
translation: After these three days, my life will end.

source_sentence: 昨夜見一面然餓鬼，而語我言：『汝於三日，必當命盡，生餓鬼中。』
translation: Last night, I saw a hungry ghost on one side and it said to me, 'In three days, your life will surely end and you'll be born among hungry ghosts.'

source_sentence: 我即問言：『以何方計，得免斯苦？』
translation: I then asked, 'What's the best way to escape this kind of suffering?'

source_sentence: 餓鬼答言：『汝若施於百千那由他恒河沙數餓鬼，及百千婆羅門并諸仙等飲食，汝得增壽。』
translation: The hungry ghost replied, 'If you give food and drink to a hundred thousand hungry ghosts of the order of 100,000 nayutas, a hundred thousand brāhmaṇas, and sages, you'll have an increased life span.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今云何得免此苦？」
translation: How can I be spared this suffering now?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告阿難言：「汝今勿怖！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, "Don't be afraid now!

source_sentence: 有異方便，令汝得施如是餓鬼、諸婆羅門及仙等食，勿生憂惱。」
translation: There are different ways to give food to hungry ghosts, brāhmaṇas, and sages like these, so don't become sad."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「有陀羅尼，名曰『一切德光無量威力』。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "There's a dhāraṇī called 'Immeasurable Power of the Light of All Virtues.'

source_sentence: 若有誦此陀羅尼者，即成已施俱胝那由他百千恒河沙數餓鬼，及六十八俱胝那由他百千婆羅門并諸仙等前，各有摩伽陀斗四斛九斗飲食。」
translation: If anyone recites this dhāraṇī, it will become a gift of food and drink for each of the 108 koṭīs, 100,000 rhesus sands of hungry ghosts, 68 koṭīs, 100,000 brahmans, and sages."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「我於前世曾為婆羅門時，於觀世音菩薩及世間自在德力如來所，受此陀羅尼。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "In a previous life, when I was a Brāhmaṇa, I received this dhāraṇī from Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva and the Tathāgata of Unsurpassed Power in the World.

source_sentence: 我當以此陀羅尼力，便得具足施於無量無數餓鬼及婆羅門并仙等食，以我施諸餓鬼食故，捨離此身，得生天上。
translation: With the power of this dhāraṇī, I'll be able to fully feed measureless and countless hungry ghosts, brāhmaṇas, and sages, and because I feed the hungry ghosts, I'll abandon this body and be born up in the heavens.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝今受持此陀羅尼，當自護身。」
translation: Now, take and keep this dhāraṇī, and you will protect yourself."

source_sentence: 即說呪曰：「那麼　薩縛(無可反，下同)　怛他揭多(去聲呼之)　縛路枳帝(一)　三(上聲，下同)跋(鞞楬反，下同)囉　三跋囉(二)　虎吽(二合)(三)」佛言：「阿難！
translation: 即說呪曰：「那麼　薩縛(無可反，下同)　怛他揭多(去聲呼之)　縛路枳帝(一)　三(上聲，下同)跋(鞞楬反，下同)囉　三跋囉(二)　虎吽(二合)(三)」佛言：「阿難！

source_sentence: 若欲作此施食法者，先取飲食，安置淨盤器中，誦此陀羅尼呪，呪食七遍，於門內立，展臂戶外，置槃淨地，彈指七下。
translation: If someone wants to give this kind of food, first take some food and drink, put it in a clean dish, recite this dhāraṇī spell, recite the spell seven times, stand inside the door, spread your arms out into the open air, place it on a clean floor, and snap your fingers seven times.

source_sentence: 作此施已，於其四方，有百千俱胝那由他恒河沙數餓鬼，於一一餓鬼前，各有摩伽陀斗四斛九斗飲食。
translation: After making this offering, there are a hundred thousand corpuscles of hungry ghosts that are numerous and numerous, and in front of each one of them there are four quadrillions and nine dippers of food and drink.

source_sentence: 如是鬼等，遍皆飽滿。
translation: Such hungry ghosts are all filled to the brim.

source_sentence: 是諸餓鬼，喫此食已，悉捨虛身，盡得生天。」
translation: After they eat this food, all of these hungry ghosts abandon their empty bodies and are ultimately born in heaven."

source_sentence: 復言：「阿難！
translation: Again, he said, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，若能常誦此陀羅尼并奉飲食，即為具足無量功德，命得延長；即成供養百千俱胝如來功德，顏色鮮潔、威德強記；一切非人、步多鬼等，夜叉、羅剎，并諸餓鬼，皆畏是人，心不忍見。
translation: If monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen can recite this dhāraṇī and serve food, they'll attain measureless merit and have their lives prolonged; they'll achieve the virtue of making offerings to a hundred thousand koṭīs of the Tathāgata, their color will be pure, and their authority will be so powerful and memorable that all non-humans, stephen demons, yakṣas, rāṣas, and hungry ghosts will fear them and won't bear to look at them.

source_sentence: 是人即為成就具足大力勤進。」
translation: That person has accomplished a great deal of vigorous exertion."

source_sentence: 復言：「阿難！
translation: Again, he said, "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若欲施婆羅門及仙食者，當取飲食，滿置鉢中，誦此陀羅尼呪，呪食七遍，瀉流水中。
translation: If you want to give food to priests and sages, you must take food and drink, put it in a bowl full of water, recite this dhāraṇī spell, recite the spell seven times, and pour the food into running water.

source_sentence: 具足奉獻無量俱胝百千恒河沙數婆羅門及諸仙等，如天飲食。
translation: It's a perfect offering to an immeasurable number of hundreds of thousands of rhesus sands of brāhmaṇas and sages, just like the food and drink of the gods.

source_sentence: 其婆羅門并仙人等，喫此食已，諸根具足、圓滿吉祥，各發其願，讚歎施人：『其施食人，心得清淨，而便疾證梵天威德，常修淨行，具足成就供養百千俱胝恒河沙數如來功德，於諸怨敵而常得勝。』
translation: After they eat this food, those brāhmaṇas and sages, whose faculties are perfectly endowed and whose fortune is complete, each gives rise to a vow and praises the donor, saying, 'That donor of food has a purified mind, which quickly makes him realize the authority of Brahmā, always cultivates pure practices, and fully accomplishes the Tathāgata's virtue of making offerings of one hundred thousand koṭīs of Gaṅgāsā, and he always prevails over enemies.'

source_sentence: 「若比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，若欲供養一切三寶，應當具辦香、華、飲食，誦此陀羅尼呪，呪所施食及香、華等二十一遍，供養三寶。
translation: "If monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen want to make offerings to the Three Treasures, they should prepare a supply of incense, flowers, and food, recite this dhāraṇī spell, and offer the food, incense, and flowers that they have given twenty-one times in worship to the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 此善男子、善女人等，具足成就諸天妙供及無上供，尊重、讚歎一切如來剎土三寶，諸佛憶念、稱揚讚歎，諸天擁護。」
translation: These good sons and good women will fully accomplish marvelous and unsurpassed offerings to the gods, honor and praise all the three treasures of the Tathāgatas' buddha-lands, be remembered by the buddhas, praise and sing their praises, and be supported by the gods."

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝去，阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, "Go, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 當自護身。
translation: You will guard yourself.

source_sentence: 并及廣為諸眾生說，令諸眾生成就具足無量功德，所生之世常值百千俱胝諸佛。」
translation: You will also explain it in detail for all sentient beings so that they will be endowed with measureless merit and will always meet one hundred thousand corpuscles of buddhas in the world in which they are born."

source_sentence: 佛說救面然餓鬼陀羅尼神呪經
translation: Dhāraṇī Sutra for Saving the Burning-Mouth Hungry Ghost
